Description: Penannular gold ear-ring in the form of a thin rounded crescent made of solid-cast metal, elaborated with three coils of gold wire wound side by side onto the central part of the loop.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site.
Curator's comments: One of the gold "earrings (figs. 2 to 7), of which about forty were found (including fragments) by the Bedawin who hunt the neighbourhood" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "gold earring, solid", ibid., p. 110, pl. xli, 6.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 6)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.82, p.84, p.186, pl.28)
